Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall, University of Chicago stood up to the title 'second home'.  Although I had some challenges to overcome, they maintained my scholarship throughout the years, were home to all 6 years of scholarship experience (2 high school, 4 undergrad), and had experienced, dedicated professors.  What needs work is the advisors.  The college advisors assigned to me knew essentially nothing about what was the best path for me to earn my major.  They overall served as more of a roadblock.  The best resource I delt with was the student advisor in the department of the major I was interested in.  The general advisors helped me put together an undoable class schedule, while the department specific advisor knew what courses were best to take earlier vs. later, and what courses not to put together in the same quarter.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Horrible work-life balance but great program options, especially in RDI departments. Easy to double major
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Chicago is a school that provides lots of opportunities for its students. As a student it will be important to seek out more opportunities and definitely get to know your professors as this will open more doors post graduation. There are activities and clubs for everyone, so don't be afraid to get involved. The social dynamics at Uchicago at what you make of it and if you find that you don't always get along with dorm mates, definitely join clubs to expand your social pool.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I so far love the academic aspect of the university: my professors have been great, the classes I've so far attended have been very engaging, and the workload does not hinder the time I need to relax outside of class hours. However, the social aspect (at least for me) feels very lackluster due to house culture not really being what it was hyped up to be and the fact that there aren't a lot of opportunities for students like myself to socialize and try to make new connections. I would definitely like to see a renewed push to promote house culture so students could be more involved with it on a regular basis, have new clubs open up that solely seek to promote socializing among students of similar academic dispositions or interests (like it would be great if there was a History Club that focused entirely on discussing history, watching documentaries, doing activities, etc.).
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great academics-- student life for successful students is quite intense depending on major, etc. Overall I am very happy to have gone here, and very grateful for the professional foundation this institution has given me.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Chicago was a great place to pursue an undergraduate degree. My classmates were extremely impressive and the professors were inspiring!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Chicago is a top-tier institution known for its challenging academics, incredible professors, and focus on critical thinking. The Curriculum ensures students gain a well-rounded education while exploring their passions in-depth. Campus life is vibrant, with numerous clubs and events, and the location in Chicago provides endless cultural and professional opportunities. While the academic environment can be stressful, supportive professors and resources like tutoring and career services help students thrive. Expanding mental health services and financial aid could further enhance the experience. Overall, it’s a place that inspires curiosity, hard work, and meaningful contributions to the world.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: great overall school and very strong academically which inherently means it is very difficult to earn good grades. An exceptional amount of opportunities and resources.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: University of Chicago is a challenging and rigorous school. My professors were all incredibly smart and kind, each one of them changed my life with their enthusiasm and intelligence. The workload is tough, and everyone is expected to work hard regardless of major. You will be tested thoroughly, but come out better for it!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
As a third-year transfer student at UChicago, my favorite part so far has been the people and the community. Everyone I’ve met—from my professors and classmates to the members of the organizations I’ve joined—has been incredibly supportive and inspiring. The collaborative environment here has made my transition much easier and has allowed me to grow both personally and academically.

One thing I’d like to see change is the transfer credit policy. While I understand the university's rigorous standards, the process of evaluating transfer credits can be frustrating. It would be great to have more transparency and flexibility in how prior coursework is recognized, especially since transfer students often come in with valuable experiences and knowledge from other institutions.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Everyone is very smart and driven and the school provides many resources for your success. It’s an amazing place.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Chicago is fast paced, almost too fast. Since it runs on a "quarter system", and starts in October, you will be having a test almost every week, and finals in only two months. It's stressful, but really engaging. The campus life is great, the people are amazing, and the programs offered are a great jumpstart to your future career and beyond.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I liked that UChicago offers need-based financial aid, which allowed me to attend. It is also academically rigorous and has well-renowned professors. What I appreciated the most was how much I've learned and grown these past few years, but I believe the quarters are a bit too short. I enjoy the quarter system, but I liked it more before they changed it in 2021. We only have one day for reading period (3 if you count weekends).
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: So grateful for this institution. Truly a place for the love of learning. Too bad the area has become more dangerous the last few years.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Great advising system. Social life is really amazing nowadays. 
Maybe it's time to change to the quarter system? 
We need more spirit with athletics.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: UChicago is a great school for the academically competitive and those really looking for a challenging experience. There is a very vibrant student life especially if are willing to broaden your horizons and explore new things. The variety of classes and electives is totally unmatched. However, the student culture is very suffering-centric and people assume you want to overwork like they do. Sometimes this environment can be stifling, but I can definitely say that I had some of the best and most in-depth conversations about education and life in general with fellow students at UChicago.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
very good and conducive environment to learn.

very good and conducive environment to learn.

very good and conducive environment to learn.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Works Here

Overall%20Experience.Review: I think that the University of Chicago is great in all aspects, both pre professional and for personal acedemic pursuits. The only thing I would change is to create a more collective campus community, however this is difficult due to the acedemic rigor placing time constraints on each student.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: So far as a first year I've been having a great time: the professors are really nice, everyone around me is very intelligent, and I only get a small amount of imposter syndrome (joke). What I've found that I've enjoyed the most about this university though is simply the amount of interdisciplinary opportunities it provides. As someone interested in both CompSci and Philosophy I think coming here has been the correct choice since the school provides many opportunities for me to combine and immerse myself in both the topic I'm interested in.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am incredibly fortunate to be attending UChicago this year. It is truly an academic haven, and the rumors of rigor are certainly upheld!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have loved my time at UChicago, as the professors are incredibly intelligent and (in my experience) pretty committed to providing the best education for their students. The social scene is much better than I thought it would be, and most students are just smart, sociable people.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: A lot of resources & prepare students well for the future. For example, they have numerous local Chicago events, career events, and internship opportunities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like the academic environment at UChicago, where everyone is deeply committed to academic excellence and intellectual pursuits. However, the quarter system at UChicago can be a little overwhelming for students who prefer a lower pace.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Campus is really pretty but far from downtown Chicago. Also a lot of the housing is kind of distant from centre of campus which can be annoying especially in the winter. Overall the culture I experienced is work hard play hard.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Chicago has a beautiful campus and environment for students to learn. Classes are challenging but offer great learning.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at the University of Chicago has been bitter sweet. I have made some cherished friendships by the end of my 1st year of college, however I would rate the party scene and social life pretty low. Everyone keeps to themselves and it feels isolating at times. The school also boasts high diversity but truly attending it doesn't always feel that way whether discussing race, class, or gender.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Chicago is a great place to continue your academic journey but is very rigorous in a lot of ways. The overall environment can be really competitive but some students can thrive in that.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I enjoyed my time at Hyde Park! I thought that the school challenged me strongly and prepared me well for post-college life.  The curriculum was thoughtful and the range of classes to take outside of my major was diverse.   The campus is beautiful and well-maintained and easy to get around.  Given the location, the school takes security very seriously and the UCPD is well-versed in the neighborhood and addresses it accordingly.  I know it's referred to as "where fun goes to die" but the students make their own fun! And having the city of Chicago to enjoy is a large benefit as well.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I was born there and now I'm about to go to school there. The University of Chicago  is good with helping people with job placement
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I truly loved my year at UChicago. I was able to have a really great balance between my academics and social life, and I achieved almost all the goals I set for myself. I genuinely met some of the most incredible people here and am so, so grateful.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall, I found it a fairly miserable place to be. They lure you in with talk about academic rigor, but the academic side gets very obsessive very quickly for a lot of people and people get hyper-focused on academic achievement and lose sight of other important aspects of life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: According to me experience at University of Chicago was fantastic,if I talk about academics it was good ,students were motivated to studies and faculty was quiet good they were there to support for any type of queries . I would not like to see any changes because according to my perspective everything was good
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Starting out at this university was not easy for me since I had to face many challenges on my own, away from family and friends I had back home. However, I had adjusted to the quarter system and found my place at the college. UChicago academics have impressed me, even with the required core classes. The professors I have met so far all appear to be enthusiastic about their specific fields, and they can be especially helpful outside of class. Given that our campus is located within a neighborhood, there are plenty of community activities and restaurants that students can hang out at, such as a Mexican-Korean restaurant called Seoul Taco. There are multiple dormitory buildings on campus, and the southern one is especially convenient as it has a dining hall, gym, and a small store all in one general place. There are also plenty of clubs, called RSOs, ranging from many types of activities like boxing or Japanese drum practice (Taiko). I would like more transportation options to explore.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like the University of Chicago for being a high-ranked academic institution with a wide range of programs. The neighborhood of Hyde Park could be safer, but the good thing is that the campus is safe enough. Also, a bid advantage of UChicago is that they provide a lot of extra-curriculum opportunities for going abroad and learning things practically. Overall, I like 100% my experience at the University of Chicago, the Social Sciences Division.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Regarding student life, there is a lot to do if you put yourself out there. Everyone that attends the University is super smart and I'm sure that everyone can find a group of people with similar interests, no matter how niche they may be.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: At the University of Chicago, life is an exhilarating blend of academic rigor, vibrant campus culture, and exploration in the dynamic city of Chicago. The Core Curriculum challenges me to think critically and explore diverse subjects, fostering intellectual growth and adaptability. Beyond academics, the campus teems with opportunities for involvement, from a cappella groups to community service initiatives, fostering lifelong friendships and personal development. Meanwhile, Chicago offers a rich backdrop for cultural immersion, from world-class museums to diverse cuisine, enriching my college experience. But above all, it's the people who make UChicago truly special—diverse, passionate, and intellectually curious individuals who inspire and challenge me daily. As I navigate this journey, I'm grateful for the transformative experiences and lifelong connections forged in this vibrant community, shaping me into a more thoughtful and engaged citizen of the world.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am an athlete at UChicago. Because this is an academically rigorous school, it can be hard to balance my studies with practices and having a social life, but that's also dependent on what someone studies. It's also a competitive environment academically, and things like greek life aren't very popular here. However, a lot of the professors here are incredible and I feel like the hard work I'm putting in now will pay off in the long run because I'll be more prepared for what I want to do after college.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I did undergrad at UChicago. After attending masters and PhD programs at other elite universities, I can really say that not many minds match up to those I met during my time at UChi. The rigor and intellect there is on a completely different level.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The university sets itself apart by offering world-class professors and research opportunities while maintaining the core values of a liberal arts university.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Excellent curriculum and faculty. Campus facilities are good. Cafeteria food is acceptable despite the high price. Maybe enhance security around the area and prevent robbery.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: They focused too much on academics, and if you wanted to get a job, then the career center does not support you
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: As someone who was very undecided coming into college, I really appreciated the CORE curriculum which had me take classes in a variety of areas to make sure my undergraduate education was well rounded. I also really loved the house culture as I was able to meet my best friends because of it. The professors were very knowledgeable in their areas and were often available outside of class to help when needed. I will say that the grind culture is very real at UChicago, and there seems to be a little pressure to study even at the expense of mental health.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Friendly 
Fully stocked with reading resources 
Conducive environment 
Maximum care given out by the university 
A variety of activities carried out
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: UChicago Academically is amazing! If you decide to be an athlete here beware! Coaches don't care about your school work.  They over train you and occupy too much of your time. The coach I had has been there for 20+ years and does not care about winning he only cares about how much money our program brings to the school.  The second you graduate he is guilting you into donating. I learned a lot at UChicago, the study abroad programs are great. I landed a great job and would attend again, but would reconsider playing sports.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: UChicago is the place for students seeking academic rigor. It challenges you to dive deep within the material, while also providing the resources to make it manageable. Any degree and major here will challenge you to grow as a learner, no matter what career path you choose. And you do it surrounded in a community of 8000 other students all with equally high ambitions, desires, and drives to succeed.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: My overall experience with University of Chicago has been great. I like the core requirement classes. There is a variety of different things that you learn and are introduced to many different academic tracks. This is especially helpful if you are undecided in a major.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: My favorite thing about UChicago is the student body. Every student here is passionate, curious, and loves to learn. People are friendly, collaborative and supportive. It's a really unique atmosphere that makes for a really transformative college experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have truly loved my experience so far at the University of Chicago. Firstly, the amount of opportunities, whether academic or social, never fails to surprise me.  For example, UChicago provides an extremely bolstered career advancement system, by helping in bringing students up to speed about applications and preparing them for post-college employment. Additionally, the community around me is unique and diverse– I have enjoyed connecting with students from all around the country, if not the world. Lastly, the campus is extremely accessible, in terms of downtown transportation, and it is beautiful. Walking through the quad at dusk or at night never gets old.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love UChicago! It gives me so much flexibility to do and study what I want - this one of the things I love about our quarter system. Also I’m super grateful for the Core because I’m exposed to so many more subjects. Also i have the space and opportunity to double major double minor and really explore my interests. The student body is great too - everyone is so collaborative (which surprised me) and we have so many fun, wacky traditions.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great mix of unparalleled academics/ career advancement resources with tons of activities on campus and lots to do in the city itself
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Academically, I think it's a top tier institution. Each class (most are seminar styled) that I have been in are extremely enriching and eye-opening - the readings and the discussions tend to teach you something every time. Socially, I like it as well. I define UChicago students as 'quirky intellectuals'.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great student body, nice campus too! Medium sized body allows us to get to know our peers well but not too well. Great professors and classes. Terrible dining and so-so housing.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I truly think the University of Chicago is the best school in the world. Nowhere else will you find a group of students and faculty so dedicated and impassioned. The students here are supportive, and the culture (academic and social) is so inclusive. Even beyond the undergraduate student body, professors and graduate students jump to include undergrads in their conversations, projects, and spaces. Most importantly to me, however, was the emphasis on critical thought and citizenship. In our core sequences, we read primary texts almost exclusively, developing our ability to form opinions; and the rigorous system of general education requirements that comprises the core ensures we are conversant in all disciplines, allowing us to critically interpret news and current events as well.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love it at UChicago!  The academics are challenging but fulfilling, and I have the most interesting conversations with people every day!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: It has been amazing. I really think the intellectual culture here alongside the fun this school has to offer is an incredible combination for students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have had the most wonderful experience thus far at UChicago. I'm surrounded by phenomenally smart peers, taught by remarkable professors, and regularly offered a whole host of invaluable opportunities. The institution has treated me quite well, and I feel a real affinity for the kind of learning—and thinking—that it demands of its students
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Half way through with my undergraduate experience at UChicago, and I have loved it so far! The faculty is really amazing, and there is such a variety of fascinating classes. All of my classmates are so smart (and fun too!), and Chicago is a wonderful and vibrant city to call home.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: UChicago is a special place. You are instructed by people at the top of their fields who are so passionate about passing that knowledge down. The environment is so collaborative and friendly. The people are amazing. Top to bottom a great experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved the people and professors are completely amazing and I've learned so much. Best choice in school ever. The food is amazing. The experience  has been everything I expected from such an amazing place.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Chicago fosters an atmosphere that encourages students to delve deeply into their academics, while also providing opportunities to build networks outside the classroom and explore diverse career paths. The curricula are designed to expose students to a range of fields. Through continuously asking "why" and formulating hypotheses, students are empowered to expand and truly value the knowledge they acquire.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Classes are often interesting but can be very tough. Especially in the first year of college, balancing classes with taking care of health and getting used to living on your own can be a challenge, although with pre-orientation programs, the University seems like it's trying to make that transition smoother. There are a lot of resources available (career, academic advising, etc.) but sometimes can be hard to access. For example, my academic advisor has changed 6 times in 3 years which has made it hard to build a consistent relationship, but I've been able to find mentorship elsewhere. Made a lot of good friends though, mostly later on in college so don't worry if you don't feel like you're meeting "your people" early on!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I definitely like that UChicago creates an environment for thriving, motivation and desiring to be a better version of yourself. It gives you ample resources to explore different career paths or even different majors. I dislike the way many people approach their interactions with others at the college; the "quirk" is taken to a whole new level and it becomes really difficult to find people that you like or that you connect with.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
At UChicago, I found the ideal blend of rigorous academics, preprofessional resources, and an extensive alumni network, which has paved the way for my dream job in private equity investment post graduation.

The academic program here is intellectually stimulating, challenging me to think critically and hone analytical skills. Collaborations with Booth Business School and the Harris School of Public Policy (YES! you can take classes at these schools during college!) have been instrumental, offering practical courses and diverse perspectives.

The university's preprofessional support at Career Advancement Office has been outstanding, guiding me through internships and career development. The alumni network, filled with successful professionals, has provided invaluable mentorship and networking opportunities.

The University of Chicago has been the perfect launchpad for my education and career development, and I never regret taking the offer during RD a few years back.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I really love UChicago. The first time I realized it was such a magical place was during Orientation Week, we had a discussion after the Aims of Education Address with our housemates.  I'll never forget how speechless I was after that discussion because I had never met so many amazing people that  truly love learning and are passionate about what they want to pursue in life. 

One of my favorite things about UChicago is its housing system because it provides an initial community when you start college. I've made some of my best friends and best memories with my house. I've gone ice skating with them, thrift shopping, we've played midnight soccer, had just-dance competitions, watched cringy rom-coms and just stayed up talking until 3am. I feel the people here at UChicago are special. They do not only welcome you with open arms but also guide you. I've had friends help me with my math-psets, advised on getting internships and helped me decorate my dorm.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: UChicago is an institution like no other. The professors are of genius calibre, the students are unparalleled in their talent and passion, and the campus itself is gorgeous. I have loved every second of my time here and I am extremely sad that it is my last year here. I will stay involved with this amazing university for the rest of my life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: UChicago constantly emphasizes the intellectual, curiosity side of academics over the pure "do work, get grades" side of academics which I think is focused on a lot in high school and in other Universities. I like to think of UChicago as preparing you for life itself as opposed to just finding a job. I've gotten to explore so many fields that I'm passionate and curious about outside of what I hope to find a job in -- after all, I'm going to have my whole life to work in my chosen field, and only so long to explore Philosophy or Nutritional Science or Film that I feel like everyone wishes they got to explore more. Not only that, but I've found some of my closest friends at UChicago -- people I know I will still talk to decades into the future. I'm also so happy with my campus involvement; I've gotten involved in so many amazing Student Orgs here, both in my chosen field and out, that really resonate with my passions and hobbies and provide me with a great community here while I'm at it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Extremely rigorous course work for STEM courses. There’s no work life balance but it’s perfect for those willing to actually work hard. This is truly a place for academics who are willing to put in the effort.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The core is amazing, the opportunities are great, the people are fascinating, and campus is beautiful. 90% of profs are awesome and my only complaints regard the universities administration (opposition to divestment, the shame that is our lack of impact on the local community) and price. The bursars office and financial aid are pretty opaque with their processes and flippant towards inquiries. Other than that though, the actual experience of attending here is amazing!!!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I've taken classes in multiple different departments and can say without a doubt that every class I've taken has challenged me intellectually, in the best way. Quarters are (perhaps a little too) short, so we're forced to hit the ground running at the start of each one - the pace doesn't really slow down after that either. There are plenty of extracurricular clubs to join, and you can (usually) create one if you none of the clubs on offer are adequate for your interests.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the intellectual community and collaborative culture. I also love being a varsity athlete and the athletic community that exists here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience has been nothing short of amazing. The staff and student body are great, with plenty of academic resources and student-run organizations.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I knew the second I walked onto the UChicago campus it was the place I wanted to go to school. After being here for a year, and now starting my second year, I can confirm I have absolutely no regrets. As a student from a very small town and high school, I was extremely nervous going into a bigger college environment. However, all the different resources UChicago provides genuinely make learning so much fun. The small class sizes, incredible professors, and free tutoring all made sure I was going to succeed and helped keep my imposter syndrome at bay. Overall, the people, the professors, and just the vibe overall make me so happy to say I'm a student at UChicago.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's been a highly challenging transition from my previous experience in the Navy but I've discovered new depths of the passion I have for learning and I know that leaving here I will have very good opportunities moving forward.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love attending UChicago! The professors are all very knowledgeable and generally love the subjects they are teaching. They are almost always willing to go out of their way to help you succeed and ensure that you get the best possible outcome from your experience. The classes are also extremely interesting and engaging! If you love learning and have a passion to collect information, you'll fit in perfectly at UChicago.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Chicago has greatly contributed to my intellectual development and fostered a confidence that I never would have attained had I not enrolled here. I am inspired not only by the quality of the instruction at this university and the breadth of programs, organizations, and resources it provides access to, but also by my peers. They are what make this institution feel like a home to me, because they challenge me to bring my best self to the classroom and beyond. I walk around this campus knowing that at any moment I could stop a passerby and have a deeply engaging conversation that would result in me learning something new or experiencing the benefit of a different perspective. The academic rigor at this institution is challenging, but I have learned that the dedication, discipline, and persistence required to do well in classes are what have shaped me into the person I am today. I am extremely grateful, and extremely proud, to be a student at the University of Chicago.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Chicago is an amazing university that has opened my perspective and postively impacted my life. I am very glad to have chosen this university and believe that it will make me a more well-rounded person. The academics are challenging, but it is well worth it. I joined the university immediately after exiting the military and I will say that the environment is conducive for people from all walks of life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Coming to UChicago is by far one of the best decisions I ever made. The school's culture is incredible, so many people are truly here to learn about what they are interested in. While this may be looked down upon in an age where college is looked at as an investment, the University's career office and countless number of alumni are more than willing to help you find opportunities, whether they be internships or full time jobs. And the reputation that this school has amongst employers is very helpful. UChicago does not have the same brand-recognition as other schools,  but the people who make decisions on employment in the hardest fields to break into know how good this school is and how thoroughly it prepares you. Students are at a significant advantage to those who attend more preprofessional or specialized colleges because this University forces you to study a variety of subjects and through that gives you the ability to learn on the job at a much faster rate.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Chicago provides a well-rounded and rigorous liberal arts education with plenty of opportunities for students to explore their interests in and out of the classroom.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I feel I learned a lot through classes, especially discussion seminars and working with other students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Really great academics and pre-professional support. Facilities / back-end services are not reflective of how much tuition is. Clubs are too competitive.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I think the classes I took were incredible. I only have issues with the 2yr live on campus requirement and the safety (lack thereof) of Hyde Park.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Classes were incredibly interesting and challenging. The campus is beautiful, and the student community is tightly knit together.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: amazing school for intellectually curious people. Definitely very difficult, but I became such a better scholar and person and much more well-rounded.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Chicago has everything you could want in a meaningful college experience. I enhanced my ability to think critically and gained practical knowledge that will benefit me for years to come. Aside from this, I have made many meaningful relationships, explored downtown Chicago, competed on sports teams, and learned to endure a real winter.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: No regrets coming to this school as there are great people, great classes, and overall a great environment!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall, a great experience. I would have liked to see more class bonding and school-wide events earlier in our undergraduate years.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: UChicago is a rare community where students are dedicated to meaningful study and debate. My seminars have been full of rich discussions and many professors have became intellectual mentors of mine. Outside of the classroom, nerdy and serious discussions rarely stop. Dorms, dining halls, and student groups are breeding grounds for philosophical debate, historical trivia, and calculus equations. I am a student government leader and president of the Israeli cultural society. Despite our reputation of where fun goes to die, I have had an unending series of opportunities to lead and grow. People at UChicago accept you for who you are. This school has been an incredible source of personal growth and one I will be sad to leave this Spring.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I've really enjoyed the rigor of the classes and the flexibility of the quarter system. Similarly, I thought that the math/stats departments are great.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
My journey at the University of Chicago has been incredibly enriching. The UChicago's reputation for rigorous academics is well-deserved, and it has pushed me to my intellectual limits. While the workload can be demanding, the personal and intellectual growth  has been immensely rewarding.

The professors at this university are exceptional. They lead discussions that are not only thought-provoking but also deeply inspiring. Their expertise and commitment to teaching have encouraged me to delve into subjects in ways I never imagined. They've cultivated an environment of curiosity, fostering critical thinking and the development of original ideas.

UChicago is a place where intellectual curiosity thrives, and it continually motivates me to reach my full potential. I am immensely grateful for the incredible journey this university has provided me thus far.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great academic climate, social life and amazing community. Everyone is so accepting and helpful it’s impossible not to live it!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: There are plenty of events going on every week snd the community is super welcoming. You will find very smart people from all different backgrounds and will help with connections psst college.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: As you might expect, it is a very difficult and rigorous school. The quarter system shortens the amount of time allocated to each class, so material moves very quickly. It also is a shamelessly capitalistic school that is definitely intent on profiting off of the student body, so don't expect much free stuff. Otherwise, it is actually more fun and social than its reputation lets on, and the campus is beautiful. It was good enough as an undergraduate institution that I decided to stay for my graduate program, but to be fair I didn't pay for the first four years, so it's easier to rationalize one more.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Extremely diverse student body; challenging and engaging intellectual and academic environment with dedicated professors
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: So far the staff and faculty have been very supportive in allowing me to change my course schedule based on my needs and goals.  I am looking forward to engaging with them further and advancing my career in the fall.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience with the University of Chicago was excellent. The admission office, especially Melissa Williams and Emma Toomey, provided exceptional and empathetic support. The academic environment was intellectually stimulating, and the faculty was knowledgeable and supportive. The campus facilities were top-notch, and I enjoyed participating in student organizations. Areas for improvement include mental health resources and financial aid transparency. Overall, a great experience
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing academic experience with super diligent, smart and passionate classmates who not only want to learn the best tools but make a positive change to the society. Professors are highly approachable and knowledgeable. You will not be surprised to meet someone who is the founder of a theroy or pioneer of a research methodology here. Highly recommended to people who are genuine interested in social science(econ, sociology, anthropology psychology, or public policy)
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: My first two years at the University of Chicago were very difficult. I was coming from a public school to an elite University. My stem classes were extremely challenging and it took some time to adjust. I really love to learn and with the fast pace of the quarter, I felt like I was just shoving information for the exam. I don't think I retained any information after taking the class of my stem courses. Outside of the stem classes, I really enjoyed exploring my interest and taking classes that aren't related to my pre-medical studies.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: School is definitely academically rigorous and the quarter system makes it even more difficult but I enjoy learning so many topics through the core and being in Chicago
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am an incoming student. UChicago has been amazing so far in the admission process. I have been on yours, overnights, and have gotten clear communication about everything and many gifts
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: It was a very challenging school, and not necessarily in a good way. There was a lot of pressure but on students, by the university, by parents, and by the students themselves. There were a lot of really cool faculty members, but also a lot of pretentious ones. But like, everyone's in it together, so it's not easy to forget that someone has your back.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: It was difficult and competitive but I learned a lot, had great professors, and made very good, smart friends.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Chicago is an exceptional institution of higher learning that provides its students with a world-class education. The campus is located in a vibrant city that offers countless opportunities for cultural enrichment and intellectual exploration. The faculty at the University of Chicago are distinguished scholars and researchers, dedicated to both teaching and pushing the boundaries of their respective fields. The curriculum is rigorous, but the rewards are immeasurable - students emerge from their time at the University of Chicago with the critical thinking skills and intellectual curiosity necessary to succeed in any profession or pursuit. Overall, the University of Chicago is a truly inspiring place that prepares its students to make a meaningful impact on the world.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: UChicago is a very prestigious school that provided me with a strong educational background and a great network of life-long friends.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Being a student at this school had its ups and downs—while it is academically rigorous (and cutthroat depending on the department), there is enough diversity of thought to find a supportive community. Many classes are taught by PhD candidates that are passionate about their work, and professors are generally approachable about research opportunities.

It can be easy to get caught up in the workaholic culture of the school, but Chicago is a wonderful city. Make the most out of it and you’ll benefit as a student, as well.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Although slightly intimidating at first, the University of Chicago has very quickly become an incredibly welcoming environment.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Chicago is a place where you can continue athletic endeavors while getting one of the best educations available. The classes are rigorous but extremely interesting. You will meet people from all kinds of backgrounds who are not only book smart, but well rounded impressive individuals.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The thing that I liked most about UChicago is the style of teaching, it's an excellent university that emphasizes how we should understand theory rather than just trying to memorize everything. That to me is the best part about UChicago. Only thing that I can see changing is the better dinning hall food, that's all!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: At the University of Chicago, I have met incredible people and taken courses with professors I really enjoyed. I participate in many on-campus organizations which are fun and informative.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The faculty are experts at what they do. The University is well built and absolutely beautiful to the eye. The campus is very diverse but most students tend to associate with their own ethnicity.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
None of the majors are a picnic, but a few in particular seem to be pretty rough in terms of workload (CS, MENG, premed track, chem/physics, etc.) If you come into UChicago with one of those majors in mind, it's quite possible you won't have a "typical" undergraduate experience. If not, it's possible to have a relatively normal student life. Teaching is for the most part good, though there are some exceptions (in my experience STEM classes taught by grad students aren't a great time.) But course reviews are a great help with that.

The size of the student body is perfect—easy enough to find people you already know, but large enough that most are open to making new friends. Lots of fun little traditions. Taking small things that few people know/care about extremely seriously is a key part of the experience.

Gorgeous campus. Location isn't bad in terms of stuff to do, but you'll have much more flexibility if you're willing to utilize public transport to explore Chicago.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Alright first year, hopefully second year is even better. Teachers are alright, but work is very challenging.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: They say UChicago is "where fun goes to die." Indeed, it is a great school for students who want to hunker down and seriously engage with difficult ideas, but you will enjoy your time at this university, and it will prepare you for your career better than any other school on the planet. Aside from engineering, UChicago pretty much has everything. Students at UChicago tend to be "quirky," but this is not universally true, and the truth is that there are more different kinds of people there each year. UChi students are typically a bit more mature and accepting, which runs tangential to the core value of  freedom of speech at the school. It does get extremely cold in the wintertime. The area is relatively dangerous, but you should be okay if you enact common sense safety measures. I believe the campus is the most beautiful in America.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
My experience at UChicago has been exactly what I have been told by others. UofC has pushed me to think in a different way than I have EVER had to think as a high school student, which has opened my eyes to a different manner of thinking through a text and/or a problem in real life. Coming from a small, rural, southern town and high school it was difficult to adjust to everything about UChicago--the rigorous academic environment, the city environment, the size of the school (it can lonely at times when you are surrounded by some the smartest students across the nation, but as long as you make the effort to make friends and find your people....you will be fine---keep in mind that it is ok if it takes some time to do so :)), but eventually one gets used to it. 

As another reviewer noted, it is VITAL for someone coming to UofC to have VERY good time management skills (or you will eventually learn to have some) in order to effectively make the most out of your time at UofC.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: They are more then generous when providing financial resources as well as academic resources. The programs offered are made accessible to those of all backgrounds, even if one may not seem financially able. It’s a great place to make platonic as well as professional connections
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: This is an absolutely fantastic school with Professors who are at the top of their field and really good at teaching. They do not make it easy though. Professors here expect high-quality work and for you to spend significant time engaging with the content. If you are willing to put in the work, you can get an astounding education here. Also, the RSOs are fantastic.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Academics can be extremely challenging at times, but you are surrounded by people who are passionate about learning, which I've found is an environment that not all colleges or universities can foster.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
The education and professors the University of Chicago offers is truly amazing.  In the year that I've attended the university, I've felt that I have grown more intellectually that in all my high-school years. Rather than pushing a memorization type of education, professors actually push you to think critically and find answers. Educationally, I HIGHLY recommend this university.

However, I must also note the negative aspects. Although the University of Chicago preaches inclusion and diversity, they don't seem to do nearly enough. Overall, UofC feels like a privileged bubble. More than that, instead of trying to incorporate and help the South Side community, UofC continuously gentrifies and uses the excuse of 'student safety' to expand their control on the South. The university does very little to incorporate its students with the city creating the overall atmosphere of an extended High-School.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
UChicago certainly lives up to the rumors of its academic rigor but it pays off because each of my classes has been full of highly engaged students excited to study and discuss the material! Unfortunately for students not very very well versed in time-management, the academic work really can take over your life and fulfill the “where fun goes to die” catch-phrase for this school so it requires some serious practice to balance fun and work. In terms of on-campus living, their “Hogwarts” style housing makes for an amazing built-in community even as a freshman. I love living in the dorms and plan to stay through graduation! 
I’d recommend this college only to students who genuinely enjoy dedicating over 50% of their time to their academics.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love UChicago. It’s not perfect, but what I often think about is that I don’t think I’d be happier anywhere else. They also have great financial aid generally.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I've had a great time setting up my research position with the faculty from the psychology department at University of Chicago.  The professors running the labs are very friendly and responsive, as are the lab students working with them.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus is beautiful, all of the staff members are helpful and friendly, they are very focused on career advising/advancement, and it's easy to tell that everyone involved with this university really cares about the students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: While often touted as "where fun goes to die," UChicago is a phenomenal school with an excellent balance of academics (plus very good professors), student life, and party scene. Class may be hard, but it is worth it to learn and know that you are getting your money's worth from this school. Student life is very active around campus, with many opportunities to join over 500 RSOs (registered student organizations). Fraternities and sororities also have a presence on campus, where if you want to join one, you can, but you don't have to.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: At UChicago there is definitely a community for everyone and the people I have met there have become some of the closest people in my life. I enjoy my major and enjoy the classes that I take but it is definitely not a walk in the park. No matter what you study, it will be a lot of work and the quarter system moves a lot faster than you might realize.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: My first year at UCHICAGO was challenging, but I got to meet the most interesting people. Everyone in Uchicago has something interesting about them and they can teach you plenty about whatever niche topic they are interested in. The professors are kind and understanding, they have definitely helped me gain new perspectives and helped me feel inspired. Everyone at this school is honestly super smart and capable and overall the people I have met are good people
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Coming in as a first-year I had no idea what to expect from my college experience. I was aware of the rigor that the University was known for having and it is indeed true. However, despite the academic challenges posed,  being a student at the University of Chicago has been an amazing experience, one that has allowed me to develop my character into something greater thanks to the many opportunities and challenges provided.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great school, wish there was better enforcement of crime in the surrounding area. Many students have died this year.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
The school experience ar UChicago is very good for students. Financial aid packages are generous, and housing is excellent. The workload at the University is manageable, but often comes in waves of very intense periods during Midterm season and final season, followed by periods of very little or no work at all. I dislike this, but some students enjoy it. Uchicago's core curriculum system is intense, requiring 15 mandatory classes regardless of your major (18 if you speak only one language). It takes about a year and a half of dedicated focus to complete. The core, though, has been an essential part of my intellectual ferment. Social sciences in particular are far more in depth at UChicago than at say, Dartmouth or Yale (based on my friends' testimonies). Overall, the school has issues, but they're minor. it's a great school.


 the Maroon dollar program lets students get $300 resteraunt-quality food each year. The cafeteria food is free, available at most times of day, and fine.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I'm miserable here all of my excitement to learn has fizzled out. Mental health is swept under the rug to give a perception of a good college. Uchicago as a university is more of a business than an institution of learning. They will try to wrangle money out of you at every moment. The only saving grace is the people here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
As an alum of the University of Chicago I certainly have mixed feelings about the school, but they trend towards the positive. Being located in South Side Chicago, some may be understandably wary of safety concerns, but having one of the largest private campus police forces definitely helps. Entering into Hyde Park and specifically onto campus is almost like entering into a different world from the surrounding cityscape. The quad is beautiful year round - with frosted buildings in the winter and vibrant 
 flowers and vegetation in the spring. Of course, the academic burden is rigorous but also rewarding. Surprising for me, was just how helpful the career advancement office was. As for a social life, when the library is one of the most hype social spaces on campus it's clear that absolute ragers aren't a top priority. You might get a few gems though...rarely. Best to find your social circle and make the most of it. Nearly half a decade with a close-knit squad can be very rewarding.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: UChicago is definitely hard, but well worth the work! You get to learn from great professors and are surrounded by very smart people
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the college! It's by far one of the best schools in the country; however, I wish more resources were put into safety.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: It’s the best school in chicago with an excellent student body and world class facility. I highly recommend it
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The buildings are beautiful, almost like they are straight out of a Harry Potter novel. Additionally, the school is very accommodating- my advisor is amazing and has been very helpful with choosing classes and figuring out my four year plan. With this the school also has great connections with internship companies.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I feel that I am incredibly well educated having attended the University of Chicago. I feel incredibly prepared to attend graduate school in the future and many of my peers already had jobs in the workplace lined up before entering our last year of school. The dorms and campus are beautiful and the Hyde Park area has plenty of restaurants and activities for students to get involved in. In recent months there have been some safety issues, but UChicago does a great job of specifically ensuring student safety via shuttle buses and the blue light system.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: This school has an immense number of opportunities to get involved in your interests and to grow as an individual and to become an integral part of the community. I was able to explore various aspects of academics beyond my main interests. I was able to achieve a diverse education.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I've been there in a summer program as a kid and I hope to return this year after admissions. Its campus is simply amazing with neogothic buildings. Its location in the middle of Chicago is also very nice. Academically, I don't think there are better places. UChicago is the best. But don't forget, that party scene and athletics is a little weak.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am currently looking at this university, however the campus is gorgeous. It is a perfect place if you are looking for a taste of city life but a good educational experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great atmosphere, education, and resources. There is a lack of communication between students and the administration that often leads to some problems but overall, a great experience and definitely the right choice on my end.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The student and campus life is great with the University of Chicago doing its best to have a secure and diverse campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Chicago is a world-renowned university with incredible resources available for success. Students are challenged in all aspects, which at times can feel overwhelming, but come out as stronger and more resilient people. You will learn about the topics you choose and more importantly, about yourself and what you want to accomplish in life. Every student at UChicago is impressive in their own way and to be surrounded by such talented people is stressful but inspiring. In terms of job prospects, the school is recognized by all employers and its reputation and alumni can help you land internships and jobs. The social scene is great if you engage with it; you will get what you put in. The House culture within the dorms are a great way to connect with your classmates and people in your House can become your closest friends at the university. The party scene is available if you look for it. The school is relatively safe if you are being sensible and careful.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Honestly, I don't get why UChicago is so underrated on Niche. It has amazing academics and good student life in my opinion. Everyone at the school is very driven and passionate about things they like to do. The academics is not easy, but it's not impossible. It challenges you properly. Plus, the student body is extremely collaborative, so if you have any problem with anything, there are always people you can reach out to who are willing to help.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: It was a good experience and the benefits continue even after graduating, with lots of resources for alumni.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I enjoyed attending UChicago and I will miss it very much once I graduate. Hyde Park is awesome and Chicago is the best city in the world. Great place
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really like the atmosphere of the campus. There is something unique about it that you will not find at any other university.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like the university's focus on rigorous academics, the resources it provides for career and academic advancement, and the variety of student organizations available on campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love UChicago in everyway except in terms of financial aid. I love the campus, the faculty, the RSOs, the career opportunities, but if you are middle/ upper middle class financial aid can be very difficult to navigate.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I think the best thing that comes to my mind is the people at the school. There is always an opportunity to strike up a conversation, and it's amazing to meet people from all over the world from Day 1!

For prospective students, I would definitely like to clarify some concerns that even I had when I was applying.  Campus life I can say is DEFINITELY improving. The new dorms and buildings are just beautiful, the food I feel like has been of consistent quality (pretty great in my opinion), and the party scene is there (not huge of course) if you want it. I think the response from students is driving these changes, especially in regard to mental health services and sustainability. The hype around academics is true...it is hard! But also incredibly rewarding!!

One score that puzzled me was campus safety. For me, I have never felt "unsafe" on campus,  including late at night. There are guards on nearly every block and even more blue lights. I feel the concerns via safety are undeserved.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: UChicago is a very unique and rigorous place. It is for people who love learning for the sake of learning and think of everything theoretically. Therefore, it has this very unique, cerebral culture, and that means student life looks different here. The best thing about this place is that everyone is passionate about something, usually many things, and that shows in the many different student groups that exist. Professors are usually also full of passion for  their subject. Also, with UChicago being internationally known, it draws students, professors, and guests from around the country and world, meaning your opportunities to meet people and to be at the forefront of many conversations are almost unparalleled. However, you have to deal with an obscenely high price tag and an administration that is uncommunicative, uncaring, and makes life very difficult for students. In my opinion, going to UChicago was incredibly valuable, but it came with many frustrations.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: My favorite part of UChicago is definitely its academics -- students are constantly encouraged to debate, rethink, and most importantly, listen. I was able to take a graduate student course as a first-year, and was amazed by the level of respectful and intellectual discussion that was possible! Students and professors alike are motivated, caring, and inclusive, and there's a strong sense of community everywhere you go, from the UCPD officer on the street corner to the dining hall staff. There's truly something for everyone, from Student Action to University Theater to Circus Club to Greek life. Regardless of extracurricular interests, however, there's an undeniable bond in the love of learning and open-mindedness that ties everyone in UChicago together.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Everyone seems very driven, but this allows for a hyper-competitive environment. Because writing and core fundamentals are stressed in the education experience at this school, most students are eloquent speakers and great writers.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
The College is a great place to expand your knowledge, however it is a bit polarizing. Depending on your major and your engagement with the Housing system you may find that you're lonely or surrounded by pirhanas for classmates. However, I have not found the college this way. I've loved every *very hard* moment there and I strongly wish I was there right now and not noticing a terrifying spider on my wall. Thanks Corona.

- Final Note: Financial Aid is very generous, everyone whose families earn under 125K/year get full tuition and below 90k gives you a host of benefits and half your room/board covered. So don't be scared off by the price!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Wonderful teachers, students, and facilities. An intellectual environment second to none. A jewel amongst American universities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Attending UChicago is like falling down a tree except instead of hitting branches you hit knowledge.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved the commitment to intellectual rigor and how the school allowed students to prioritize theory.  The location in Chicago is not the best because the university acts like an (white, affluent) enclave in the middle of  majority black and brown neighborhoods. I do think that the prioritization of theory can have some downsides, especially for those who graduated in the humanities and social sciences.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: U of C has a huge library, tasty coffee shops and amazing professors. People like to say that UChicago is where fun comes to die, but the student life and fun is found in things like Moda fashion shows and other super interesting student groups. There actually are parties here because of Greek life. The campus is beautiful and nice to walk around.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I've really enjoyed my time so far at UChicago! It's a great school overall, and the academics and people I've met are my favorite part. This school is perfect for students who love learning. I think there could be more of a focus on student mental health services.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Love the diversity of thought and the freedom to express them. The core really focuses on interdisciplinary learning, and I recommend it to anyone who would want to experience learning about various disciplines (or to anyone who is undecided about their major!)
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: University of Chicago is an excellent university. It has an international accredited study abroad program and amazing research opportunities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: The community that the dorm system forms is unbeatable, especially coming in as a first year not knowing anyone else at UChicago.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: A challenging academic environment, but with a lot of helpful professors and teaching assistants. The campus is beautiful, and accessible to the city, and there's always a lot to do around the school. Dorms are a bit old fashioned, but very cozy, and the house culture at Snell-Hitchcock is amazing. There is also a lot of support from career and academic advising, as well as a lot of resources to help students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Chicago is the forefront of innovation, sparking creative/curious thought processes within students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great school full of hard working people - however, sometimes the professors arent great (For my major, biochemistry).
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: This is the place for the intellectually curious, for the smartest nerds in the world to solve problems together, and the place for the quirky geeks that want to head into academia or wall street.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: They support students with less opportunities than others. I appreciate how they help families with immigrants and families that earn less money that is necessary to pay for a expensive 4 -year university. I think that because they provide opportunities to students that come from more difficult backgrounds, it will be very helpful and make college seem more realistic for everyone.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved every single thing about this place! Excellent academics, great student body, a nice neighborhood that is close to the city. I wouldn't change a thing except developing the surrounding area more.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I could not be happier with my Chicago education. I have found that the dividends and rewards only increase with time; it left me with the ability to think critically - to separate truth from fiction, to understand others' reasoning, to contemplate ways to separate and attack problems - a skill that is proving invaluable in my career. I'm a recent graduate, and I found that the academics were unparalleled and that I met amazing amazing people at the school - my closest friends are all fellow Chicago alums who are now around the globe pursuing their interests and passions to the highest level.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I did not like how emotionally cold the environment was. They make light of the fact that their students never have any fun, which in my mind just means they think the huge mental health problem that the school has is a joke.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Pretty expensive but overall a good environment for people who want a challenge in college. Not just for one type of person, and you can definitely find your fit.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: There are only two downsides of my UChicago experience so far: the weather and the cost of attendance. Otherwise, it's a fantastic school. There's so many opportunities available to students and every person I've met has had something interesting about them. Of course, there's a heavy workload but it makes you grow so much intellectually. I've learned and absorbed more in the past year than in the ten before it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Liked: the school is not focused on athletics at all, which is great because I've heard that some schools are centered around their teams; not a huge party school but there are parties hosted by frats on the weekends (good if you're not interested in the party scene)
Disliked: there's not a lot to do in the local area (there's just MSI, a bowling alley, a small theater, pathetically small Target, a couple of restaurants), so you're gonna have to go into the city; dining hall food will decline over the course of the year
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Chicago has an incredibly welcoming and yet challenging atmosphere that is unlike any other. The Core Curriculum introduces truly applicable frameworks for critical thinking that can the applied in a diverse curriculum.  At UChicago you can attend your Physics lecture in the morning, work on your film project until you participate in a religious discussion in the afternoon and rehearse with your traditional African music group in the evening. In spite of the lack of affordability, UChicago does offer various ways of financing, including generous financial aid and merit-based scholarships. However, Uchicago is not need bling to international applicants, which is likely to discourage low-income international students to apply.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I’m about to start my first year but just from visiting the campus back in April I could envision myself attending the school. Uchicago is the epitome of socioeconomic and ethnic diversity. The academia is one of the best in the country and the school provides amazing financial aid!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Chicago prepares you to be successful. You are taught by world recognized researchers, and connected to the city of Chicago. It has a long history of excellence
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Love it here, just surround yourself with positive people.
It is very important to find clubs and activities that get you out of the books and into the world.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Very rigorous study environment that demands a large portion of your time, and they do not do a very good job of steering you in the proper direction to do whatever you wish to do after graduating. There are plenty of very good, average, and very bad professor's so it is more so about asking other students who the right professors to take are.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Situated at Hyde Park, an already openly diverse neighborhood, the University of Chicago provides a unique environment which consists of a diverse community of students, faculty, and staff. The University offers an array of programs and activities for various subjects and fields. The architectural work on each campus is breathtakingly beautiful. Everyone is welcoming and respectful of each other. Enrolling at The University of Chicago will give you the best experience ever and you will find yourself craving for more.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Chicago is an incredibly difficult place to attend school. You will be pushed to your limit in almost every way. However, after 2 years I have become a firm believer that this kind of pressure is absolutely necessary to reach the next level. UChicago heavily emphasizes the need to think critically and independently, and for this reason graduates are successful everywhere they go. If you have a burning passion to improve yourself as a person, UofC is absolutely the place to be.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: A great experience!  Definitely rigorous and not for the faint of heart.  Academically excellent, fantastic research opportunities, diverse, professors are amazing.  I participate in varsity sports and it's a great community.   The surrounding City is amazing...tons to do.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the University of Chicago for it's intense curriculum that is focused on excellence and critical thinking.  However, the University could do a better job of providing graduate student housing.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: All around great school, definitely don't come here unless you're willing to put in the work. Not the best social scene/athletics, but the professors and peers are unmatched.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Excellent  teaching and intellectual community. However, high stress and academic demand. You can feel it in the community.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Quarter system is making it difficult to get a job. I feel ashamed every day to be a part of a community that hires its own police force to police and harass the residents  of the south side. No real diversity on campus, and black people on campus are often harassed and arrested by the UCPD in their attempt to seal campus off from the rest of Chicago.
