I've spent the last week unable to get basic healthcare on my University insurance, and begging various job opportunities to accept me even though I graduate in June and am on the quarter system. There are definitely some smart people here, and I enjoy a lot of my classes, but this place is a hotbed of depression, suicide, racism, and elitist morons. The only reason I would come here is if you are interested in academic research, know you want to go straight to PhD, and got a full ride.  If I could do it again I would have gone to UMASS.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: So many research opportunities and career paths the school offers and Chicago State has a good faculty, staff and choices for food.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: The academics here are incredible. You are able to have access to some great educators and resources because of the wealth and connections at the school. However, the social life here is lacking. There is also a weird culture because of how many privileged people attend this school - everyone is always networking.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really liked how supportive the community was. I also like how everything in the city feels accessible, and I am also getting a quality education.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved the way everyone on campus is because they are so nice and helpful. I had an overnight stay on the campus and it was so beautiful and the students helped each other with work. I also liked this because I can get help from other students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Food's good. Don't even go here. I only go here because my great grandfather donated what would be $30 million to this college back in the 60s.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I love this university, truly, but the financial aid can be pretty terrible for middle class families. I'm making it work this year, but last summer I worked three jobs, about 55+ hours a week, and both of my parents had to take on extra work, while my Mum was still in graduate school. Not only this, but I had to take out a loan--something the university is supposedly very against.

That being said, while I am upset with the administration of the school, there is no better place for me, and while I've had to work myself to death to get here, I believe it is worth it. The classes I take are incredibly interesting, rigorous, and well taught. I love my professors, and my peers. My house is very much like a family, and I love the kind of discussions we can have.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: University of Chicago is an excellent choice. Upon first visiting I knew this is the place I wanted to go to school and I have no regrets about apply ED. Everyone here is so friendly and nice. Professors always encourage you to go to tutoring or office hours if you are struggling and classes (at least the ones I have taken thus far) are small enough that they get to know you on a personal level. Classes are challenging yet still engaging. Peers love to engage in intellectual discussions. Dining hall is pretty good and housing is excellent. I got placed into Burton-Judson and am in Vincent house (best house). We have very fun house traditions and we have all become very close with one another. I highly recommend applying. :)
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Chicago is a great academic environment that provides a good return on investment.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: It’s been an amazing experience. I feel home since day one. I love that we have houses, so every weekend we get together with our house, it is like a family. There is a lot of diversity and academically is outstanding.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: AMAZING architecture, school looks like right out of a movie. Great people too! All semi rich, and too smart for their own well being, but they'll make great additions to this world, and i'm very proud to have applied here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: University of Chicago allowed me to grow as a student and figure out my interests. Being a liberal arts school I didn't feel ready for work after graduating.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: When I took a college tour of the University of Chicago, it was amazing! The campus is beautiful and has a very welcoming atmosphere. Everything  about the university makes you want to apply!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: It’s just the best place in the whole world. The architecture the teaching staff the students the food everything is amazing. And breathtaking. I wander around every day and wonder how I came o be so lucky.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Challenged every day and applied analytical skills to lively class discussions as well as written work. Professors are always available and the students are of varied backgrounds, both of which keep students engaged. Love my school!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I came to the University of Chicago to learn and be surrounded by people who had a vast appreciation for knowledge. I can say with great confidence that this expectation has been met. Every day at UChicago I am surrounded by people who cherish learning and encourage others to as well. I have never heard a boring conversation while walking the campus. People at UChicago help one another thrive and learn. It has created a community where individualism is appreciated and encouraged. The experience that you get at UChicago will depend entirely on what you put into it and the possibilities in that sense are endless.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Chicago is an inviting and academically-oriented community. People here, both students and professors, are ready to take on any conversation from most viewpoints. I really enjoyed my first year here, from taking classes with small sizes and engaged professors to lounging in all of the libraries on campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience with University Of Chicago was amazing, all aspects of student life, academics, along with the amazing Campus provides a true college experience. The area of Hyde park is somewhat safe but some aspects of safety could be improved such as more lights on the campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: The way the University approaches teaching and learning is remarkable. At UChicago, the aim is to teach the students how to think instead of what to think. The academics as well as students and student life are beyond excellent.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Chicago is a very rigorous school and it can be hard for some people. Sometimes it's really nice and other times it's not.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved everything about it. It's what you make of it; however beware, if you are not interested in learning for the sake of learning, you will likely not be happy in this environment. The shortened school motto is 'life of the mind,' my friends and I like to joke that if we had wanted a job, we would have gone to Harvard, but we wanted to learn, so we went to UChicago. However there were almost always parties at night, and the winter is not so bad. It's one of the last higher education bastions of free speech left.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's nice to see that the University has increased campus diversity of financial aid resources for families that will make the campus more diverse in terms of student backgrounds. I enjoyed my time in college housing a lot! Get involved with your house - go on house trips, play intramural sports, take on a leadership position. If you need something - speak up and ask for it! You really can have a say in your university. Don't be shy to speak up and ask questions. The University can only continue to improve with that kind of input.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Love this school! Great experience! The academics are invigorating and the professors are demanding, but I learned so much.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: UChicago is an amazing place to be, with so many opportunities and spectacular people to meet and interact with.It is very demanding on students but that's expected of such an institution.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: There's no place else in the world where learning is cherished in the same fashion than it is at the University of Chicago. The tagline "the life of the mind" can often be found on marketing materials for the university, but it truly does ring true on campus. Academics and intellectual rigor at UChicago are unrivaled.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: My time at UChi so far has been great. The academics here are unparalleled, and I've grown exponentially as a writer and critical thinker. The faculty are all so invested in their teaching, and it is reflected in the amount of availability there is outside of class to meet and discuss assignments or concepts from class. Career services is also really helpful in prepping for interviews and touching up resumes, so if you engage with their office, you have a leg up in any job search. Playing sports here is an interesting pursuit, as I play on the basketball team, and although it is an awesome experience, there is little student support. On-Campus living is best in Max P, but North Dorm is also really nice having lived there for my first year. Overall, I really enjoy UChicago.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I graduated from the UofC in 1975. I have had an amazing career since then; it has been full of adventure, challenge, economic rewards, diversity, travel and fun. My dreams have been 95% fulfilled.  I have no doubt that I owe it all to the doors that the UofC have opened for me.  My kids have studied at Yale, Harvard Law, Georgetown, LSE and Harvard Ed School. Seeing how my kids have enjoyed to each of these schools, it is clear to me that only Yale measures up.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great experience! Rigorous yet tangible education that prepared me very well for a career in economics. Might great friends and had great experiences
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: This is an amazing university beside an amazing city, which I’m sure many are aware of. There is a very diverse and nice community here and I’ve had a great experience so far.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Love Chicago, great dorm life/house culture, career services are helpful, and professors are helpful & experienced, wish the science core was less intensive
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Just over a year ago, I came to UChicago expecting to live the life of the mind--and I have been engrossed in that life ever since. I have learned so much academically, taking classes including Advanced Computational Modeling for Biology, Organic Chemistry, Introduction to Language Development, and Introduction to World Music. I have learned to think, to take risks, to consider questions I wouldn't have otherwise explored. Being at UChicago has also allowed me to immerse myself in the South Side community as my House's Civic Engagement Representative.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Ive had an amazing experience at UChicago. While here though I found the school difficult the lack of competition is truly amazing. Furthermore, the ability to learn from noteworthy faculty, and do research with them, still amazes me.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved the campus . They are always friendly to visitors . They also keep everything clean and they make sure you know what you want . the students are always happy to talk to you and or answer your questions. I love the diversity and the acceptance for people who are different.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: First I would like to start by saying the staff is so important to any organization because those are the first people you see before you really start classes. They are very helpful to my needs and as well as to others needs they really take the time out to answer any questions that I need answer to and very understanding I recommend anyone going to college to go to this school if you would love customer service and friendly environment this is the place to be.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I work at the University of Chicago. The students and facility are nice and caring. You get to meet a lot of people from all over the world.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Works Here

Overall%20Experience.Review: What I liked about the University of Chicago was its challenging curriculum known as "Core". It's a very pretentious school with outstanding standards based on academia. The University of Chicago is probably the best school, based on academics, all the whole Midwest region.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: University of Chicago gives you a wholesome educational experience due to the core curriculum. However, enrolling in classes is not an enjoyable experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I took part in HSF's Leadership Institute at the University of Chicago. I stayed in a single dorm that was neat and well kept. The campus was easy to navigate around and the food was particularly good. I ate at Cathy every day!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: So far I have greatly enjoyed my experience at UChicago. The activities,  people, and culture of the school is incredible. I have found myself transformed since starting school back in September. I am more engaged, excited, and optimistic about my future endeavors than ever before!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I'm a female who is very interested in weightlifting. Ratner's good, with a decent amount of equipment, but doesn't have the space needed for ab workouts and additional cardio machines since those currently there are almost always in use. Good number of squat racks. Pretty male dominated. I've also participated in some intramural Volleyball in the Field House and the floor is like a popcorn ceiling - if you go down after a ball, you'll lose skin. Needs to be resurfaced.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I personally am not involved in Greek Life all that much. It isn't really a big part of the UChicago experience, however, Greek parties are widely attended and are usually pretty fun!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Varsity sports are not a very big part of life at UChicago, but intramural and club sports are cherished, and have very high levels of participation and fan support.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is only there if you want it to be
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The facilities are nice, but almost for nothing.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life isn't emphasized on campus. There are some events that are well-attended, but for the most part, it isn't a big part of campus life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics aren't super important to campus life. House intramurals are pretty popular (depending on the house and the sport), and in some cases can be important to house culture, but aren't important in the scope of overall campus life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is a great way to make friends initially at this school. I am not in Greek life, but tons of my friends are and they seem to really enjoy it and the community service activities involved with it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: As a softball player, the division 3 varsity athletics are ideal for me.  It is a great way to stay active and involved with the sport you are passionate about, while also having enough time to focus on academics, too.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I love Greek life and think it's a great thing to join if you're looking for a bigger social life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Not a super athletic school
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I am a member and I love it. Great sense of community.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I very much enjoy being a spectator at sporting events! Great social events!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is very big to those in Greek life and not important to those outside of it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The only thing lacking is student support, probably because people are stuck studying all the time.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Varsity athletics are important to varsity athletes while the rest of the campus mostly ignores them. Some of the houses have a pretty big intramural sports culture.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There's a lot of diversity on campus. Also, different facilities for different types of minorities.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Different options are available if you choose to pursue them. Not a huge factor in campus life.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: The school can be too liberal at times but it's alright.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There is hardly a school spirit when it comes to athletics. Not a bad thing—just we're hyper-focused on academics.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Not a fratty school. Good looking people are in frats/soros, but it doesn't really matter.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: They are nice. Not super huge. The source of most scandals tbh.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: It's fine. No one cares about it and they do okay i guess
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: It's not a huge factor here. Some people join, others don't. Occasionally Greek life causes controversy among students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: People are very welcoming of diverse viewpoints and peoples.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life isn't that important to most students here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: No one cares about athletics on this campus, but the facilities are actually quite nice.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Lots of intellectual diversity and a good number of international students.  University makes an effort to promote diversity of economic background with several scholarship programs.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Pretty small, but visible for their parties, which are well-attended.  Parties are generally not exclusive which is nice.  Occasionally frats or sororities get in trouble, but generally they are pretty well integrated into campus life without being widespread.  Social opportunities outside of Greek life are present but somewhat limited, but most students are more focused on academics or their careers anyway.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Nobody pays much attention to the official school teams in any sport.  The facilities are pretty nice, especially Ratner, but it can be crowded.  Plenty of intramural opportunities for more casual athletes.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Pretty much everyone I've met is super accepting - people take into account preferred pronouns, which is something that I realize not every school does.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Sports are played on campus, but varsity teams/school matches definitely aren't as big here as they may be in other schools.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life in general is an outdated social aristocracy that nobody should care about--and here, hardly anyone does.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Pretty fun, low key, still serious about academics.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Could have been a lot worse. We don't have crazy rape stories at least... And sometimes the parties are fun.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I am not really involved or interested, but my friends seem happy about it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: It's exactly what you would expect at a really academically rigorous, division III school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: This campus is super diverse with a wide range of students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There are of course people that lack social skills but the guys here are much cuter than expected. Bonus points for the fact that they're all super smart and ambitious.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: It's great because it isn't like Greek life at state schools. It's very much participate-if-you-want. If you have no interest, that's fine, you don't need to have anything to do with it. But otherwise it's pretty fun and a good way to meet social people and get involved on campus with philanthropy events, etc. Sororities don't have houses.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: They are pretty relaxed about most things and treat students like adults.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: They understand that we are college students, and there are certain things we are going to do (drink, party, etc.)
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
The University of Chicago uses its gigantic private police force to selectively enforce the laws that protect rather than inconvenience its students.  Chicago police are far too busy to come on our campus much.  The UCPD doesn't care at all about students drinking, partying, or using drugs, as long as they aren't also destroying property or committing some other more serious crime.  UCPD officers see kids smoke marijuana all the time, for example.  The neighborhood around campus is absolutely crawling with UCPD officers after about 9 or 10 PM, which is understandable given the campus is very close to Englewood and other rougher areas, but it's a little weird seeing a car parked on every block.  The surveillance is extensive and a little unnerving, but again, they aren't in it to arrest students, just protect them.  

In terms of alcohol use in the dorms, it's allowed under certain fairly lax conditions, and even if those aren't met, real consequences are few and far between.  Some students have been kicked out of housing for dealing illegal drugs, but that's pretty understandable, and the policy within dorms is generally very easygoing.  I've had drunk conversations with my RA and RH while I was underage, for example.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: The people are very smart, friendly, and hardworking.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: It's not particularly strict. CPD comes around to break up parties sometimes, and they usually give a hard time, but the UCPD is attentive and lenient.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone is smart, but other traits vary.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life throws most of the parties and is very easy to get into, but still only a small fraction of the student population.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Varsity sports are mostly ignored. Some houses get very into intramural sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Drinking in dorms is fine, just not in common areas. Not too strict about drugs either depending on the house you're in.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: People complain about the dating options at UChicago way more than they should. Any student you meet will be intelligent and excited about learning. There are lots of cute boys in sweaters and glasses and many girls are fashionable. Some kids can be pretentious or snobbish but most everyone you meet is pretty nice and friendly.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Coming from a cheerleader, Maroon pride is a little lacking. However, not many people look down on sports, they just don't seem to realize that sporting events are happening. The football did very well this past season and students seem excited to hear that but usually don't hear about it. Many people are active and Ratner is a nice facility. House intramurals are very popular and many people also participate in club sports (of which there are many)
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: If you're looking for robust greek life, you probably won't get it at UChicago. Many first-years go to frat parties but after o-week you'll probably end up going to apartment parties or house (dorm) parties.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The University has a small Greek life comparatively. They host some events and are somewhat present.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: While varsity athletics are perhaps not the most important or most attended events on campus, there is some student involvement. However, intramurals have a much higher participation and attendance rate and are generally supported fairly well.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: For the most part the school administration is adequate enough. However, there have been recent events which have occurred that required more administrative authority than they gave. This has been a problem in the past, especially when it comes to dealing with groups who support minorities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The administration is very lax and mostly wants the students sale. If you have a problem, socially, I wouldn't use them as a channel but when it comes to creating new academic opportunities, they are very good.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: The guys and girls on campus are all very smart - and there are definitely quite a few people that care about quality clothing and fashion. As far as attractiveness - I would say that it's pretty standard - most people are OK looking, with a few outliers.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are quite a few wealthy people here, but there's no sense that people flash/show off their wealth. The school is really accepting towards LGBT kids and other minorities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Chicago is a division 3 school, so most kids here are not here for the athletics, but plenty of people participate in IM sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Chicago is a very well run school. The administration does a lot to bolster student life on campus and is pretty well organised.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The fraternities and sororities are honestly pretty benign. There are really diverse characters in greek life: LGBT people, different minorities, your atypical sorority girls. Differs from state school greek life in a big way, greek life is a welcome and fun presence on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Accepting of everyone. But in not the annoying way where everything gets dressed-up and over-analyzed. Just happily accepting, and everyone moves on and are friends and goes to learn stuff.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone's pretty much a happy nerd, and very friendly.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Extremely accommodating of students and focused on making sure undergrads are happy and can find things to do.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Perfect school spirit, in that everyone realized sports don't matter at all, and we were all far happier for it.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: No pressure to join these, decent places for a party.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Not a huge focus for uchicago
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I play Varsity football, stands are empty except for parents, most students don't know we have a football team at all.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Campus is intellectually focused, so Greeks largely ignored, except as a place to find a party.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: It's still young and needs to grow. Wish it was a bigger part of campus life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The Greek scene isn't huge but it is there if it's something that interests you
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life isn't overly popular on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: This campus is extremely liberal and the students are mostly trusted with taking care of themselves and being responsible. The administration know that we all work hard and the students care about their classes, so they don't stress to much about us getting out of control.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Very diverse. Many opinions are voiced on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Small greek community that is quite inclusive. Some people will treat you differently if you are in a fraternity, though.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Campus is not at all strict. UC police is there to protect you, not to monitor you.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Not many people are passionate about sports.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Hang out with however you want, no one will usually judge.  The only problem I have is that acceptance of other political beliefs is not welcome.  The vast majority of the campus is extremely liberal, so any somewhat conservative idea is shot down immediately and ridiculed.  Also, international students are nice and add to the diversity on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: UChicago does not care what you. You can walk up to a UCPD officer with a joint in one hand and a six pack in the other and all they will do is make sure you are heading in the right direction and are safe.  Just don't do anything stupid and no bad consciences will follow.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: No one cares about sports here.  UChicago had the first Heinemann Trophy winner, but everyday I hear someone ask if we have a football team.  We also have the McDonalds All American Dunk contest here every year, but students do not often show up, just the Hyde Park community.  IM sports are somewhat popular, but no one really cares.  The athletic facilities are extremely nice though, with Ratner being recently built.  Crown is older, but it was renovated and is mostly where the athletes lift and practice in the winter.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Take it or leave it.  Within the Greek community, there a range of fraternities to join that focus on different ascents of Greek life.  For example, some fraternities exists solely for parties while others focus on charity, brotherhood, etc.  There are only a handful of sororities, but they do not have houses.  The Greeks often get along, with healthy rivalries in IM sports and charity events.  However, non-Greeks either do not care about or unfairly look down upon Greek life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There's aggressive acceptance of anyone, and a variety of different nationalities, ethnicities, sexualities, gender identities, economic statuses, etc.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are plenty of attractive guys & girls of all sorts of styles (except perhaps preppy). If you make the time, you can find a very fulfilling relationship.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The Greeks throw mediocre parties full of sad and resentful people. No one likes or appreciates them otherwise. If they were to suddenly vanish, some underground student organization would definitely step up to continue Wednesday Bar Night.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: So this is VERY qualified: the students generally love intramural sports, there's huge participation, there's great spirit and competition in them, etc. BUT there is absolutely no spirit or appreciation for varsity sports. No one cares. There is a similar level of involvement. Likewise, there is no school spirit as regards sports or athletic ability. I don't even know how good our teams are.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The UCPD doesn't care at all about underage drinking or illegal drugs--just making sure people are safe and neighbors aren't disturbed--and on the streets they're very warm and friendly. Having guests in dorms is incredibly easy, and only really requires that you check them in at the front desk; after that, they could stay several nights provided you can get them a place to sleep. In lectures (and some seminars) attendance counts for essentially nothing. How alcohol and noise are viewed in your dorm depends on the RA, but generally they're very lax.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It's a really diverse campus, which can afford those who need the support of their own community to find it while also exposing people to a large variety of backgrounds, which is really cool. It's a great experience.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The Frats throw parties, which makes up most of the social scene, at least for underclassmen. It's whatever.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There really isn't much of a following here, but our teams aren't bad and if you're involved, your friends will definitely care enough to come out. But again, it's not a huge deal.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I have found all greek organizations to be super inclusive, there is no pressure to join and all on campus parties are open.  If you do decide to join, it's a great community and a great support system
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There is definitely a lot of white people, and finding those in niches is not that easy, but clubs exist to bring them together.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It's definitely there if you want to participate, but not that popular.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: No one really cares about athletics and athletes, to the point where we don't know anything about them.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Fraternities throw parties from Wednesday Bar Night up until the traditional Saturday night frat parties.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are many types of people to meet here on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: This school is not very strict with personal lives outside of class.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The people you meet here are the best. These are the people you want to know forever.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: You can be as active as you want to be. They have lots of fitness programs.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: You'll meet every kind of person here. There are plenty of upperclass students, but there are certainly also less wealthy students.
Student%20Life.Author: Niche User

Student%20Life.Review: There are plenty of attractive students here, and enough of them that it's completely possible to find attractive people to hook up with/amazing people to date. I'm in a long-term relationship that started last year, and I have plenty of friends who have frequent hookups with attractive people. That said, there are of course plenty of nerdy/awkward/socially unaware types, but it's definitely less the norm than it used to be.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The atmosphere is overall pretty lenient. It definitely depends on the house (if you're in housing), but the university's policy seems to be that you can pretty much do whatever (particularly if you're out of housing) as long as you're not harming anyone or posing too much of a threat to yourself. If you're in housing, though, it's contingent on your RH's/RA's.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I'm sure it's fun to be on a varsity team but nobody on campus pays attention to varsity sports and there's no spirit. I wish there were more of a sports culture on campus. It would be nice to dress up in maroon and get some beer and popcorn at a game, but it just doesn't happen.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The athletics are Division 3 so not too many people care.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The girls are kind of cute, but I am in a relationship so I don't really look.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I don't know too much about Greek life here as I have no interest in it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: For the most part, I have seen very little intolerance of any kind.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I have good friends. Everyone seems every nice and helpful.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Team performance is a very great thing that helps students develop to work with others.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: The campus police and administration are not at all strict. Alcohol use and underage drinking is visible and no one (administration or police) cares. As far as noise violations, it's not at all uncommon for apartment parties to get shut down for being too loud, but that's only when the neighbors call the police to complain. "Visitation in dorms" is also very relaxed. You have to sign guests in, but that's it. Overall, I'd rate the campus as very lenient, and it's great.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review:
I may not be the best to comment on this: I'm a straight, white, middle-class, liberal, non-religious male, but from my view it isn't an issue if you're in a minority group. 

Economic status: There are rich kids, there are a lot of middle class kids, there are some lower class kids. In my experience I have no idea who is who unless I'm friends with them, but perhaps the experience is different for others. 

Ethnic heritage - There are large Asian and Jewish populations on campus. There also seem to be a good number of Indian-Americans. I'm sure you can find stats on ethnicity breakdown. I haven't noticed any segregation along ethnic lines among social groups, but I could be naive. 

Political affiliation - As with almost all campuses, the student body is largely liberal. That said, the majority of students are not involved in politics and probably wouldn't care all that much if you were conservative. There is a College Republicans group, I'm not sure how well-attended it is, but they do exist.

Religious background - I'm sure the majority of the student body would identify as non-religious, but there are certainly populations that adhere to the major religions and there are services available if you're interested. 

Sexual orientation - There's a decent-sized LGBT community here, and people are pretty open about it. I haven't experienced any homophobia, but then again I'm straight so I probably wouldn't.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review:
There are frat houses for guys, but state law prevents sorority houses for girls (something about being classified a brothel? Who knows.) Anyways, sororities still exist, they just don't live together. 

It's very much what you make of it. If you want to be involved in greek life: join a frat, go to frat parties, etc. then it definitely exists and is somewhat popular. That said, if you don't have an interest in greek life, it's very possible to spend four years here without ever setting foot in a frat house. I would guess something like 10% of the students are in a frat or sorority.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: being a top tier school...diversity is hard to avoid
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: teams might suck, facilities are amazing
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: way more attractive people than expected
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: fraternities are better here. sororities are dif
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Honestly, there is a wide variety in terms of guys and girls. Probably less preppy and athletic types, but they exist, too. Most people are pretty friendly, and everyone, of course, is very smart.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There is a large presence of international students, which is really interesting. There's visible ethnic and religious diversity, though it isn't as large as I thought it might be. All in all, diversity was a huge aspect in my college search and I'm happy here so far.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The athletic facilities and (free!) classes offered are great, but varsity athletics are not a big part of student life here at all. Each house participates in intramurals and club sports are common, so finding people to work out with/play sports with isn't a problem. It's just that there isn't school spirit revolving around varsity athletics.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Some people in my dorm drink and have parties relatively regularly, and I do know of drug use that goes on.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: We're one of the most diverse universities with people from all over.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: A lot of the boys tend to be slightly awkward and into their schoolwork, but with that being said, there are many social boys and you can definitely find some cute ones. Plus they're all really smart!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
Sororities don't have houses, there are only four actual ones and some more non Panhellenic ones. 
The frats have houses and are much bigger, host parties every weekend and are really great.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Varsity sports are often overlooked at UChicago. More attention is placed on IM sports. There are numerous house tournaments held year-round for different IM sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Very quiet. People are largely indifferent about them. If you're not involved in Greek life, most don't really care.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There are four sororities but no sorority housing. As far as fraternities go, some of them are active in the community and there are parties most weekends; however, the stereotype at Chicago is to look down on those in Greek life. The school doesn't support the presence much and neither do the students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Most campus police are here to protect students from surrounding gangs
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I have found a greater diversity of experiences and backgrounds here than in my high school, but our campus really needs significant improvement in helping students discuss and teach about differences of race, sexuality, and socioeconomic status without causing hurt and mistrust. It doesn't take much digging (hint: chicagomaroon dot com) to learn why I'm saying this.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Very eclectic. They are a wide range of "types" and corresponding tastes. I suppose anyone could find what they're looking for if they look hard enough.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: I personally don't care about sport culture so I don't know much about sport culture at Uchi. There are varsity sports and vide range of intermurral sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I love the boys at UChicago. Every single guy has something interesting about him whether it's his skills in the wood shop or maybe his intense interest in Kant's theories. There are different types of guys- the frat bros who  like their biceps and will show you a good time, the nerds who are super into their studies and video games, the hipsters who will engage you in an interesting conversation over a cigarette, and the guys that are just studying and trying to have fun and figure out their place in the world.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Varsity sports at UChicago are not especially prominent. There are a small group of students who go to most of the basketball and football games but otherwise it is not a huge part of student life. There are really nice workout facilities though!
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: I haven't had any greek experience but there certainly is a scene if that's what you're looking for.  Not as big as some other schools, that's for certain.  But there are frats that have parties regularly.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life awareness is improving though the relations between the Panhellenic and NPHC(Divine Nine) groups could be better. Students are becoming more aware of the good we do on campus and in the community rather than focusing on the parties certain frats throw every weekend.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: If you're looking for the greek life experience, there is a large enough population here that are right there with you and you can party with. However, it really is not a big part of UChicago and you can spend your entire time here without visiting a frat s you want. The fact that our in a fraternity will not change your social status, and is simply a way to party and make connections.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Extremely ethnically diverse. There are students from all over the world. However, the school definitely lacks in socioeconomic diversity, as can be expected from a school as expensive as this. Also, the majority of students seem to come from the eastern US, with very, very few coming from the west.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are actually a lot of cute guys here, but that being said some of them aren't pursuing otherwise. They can turn a conversation about any topic into a super intellectual one, which can be a little intimidating if you just want to step away from the school's hyper intellectual culture sometimes. The girls here are really put together.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are all kinds of people at UChicago. Yes, there are a lot of nerdy people. But there are also a lot of wonderful people. (Almost) everyone loves to learn and has a passion about knowledge and a lot of people are very interesting to talk to!
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics are not huge, but they are present. We used to be a Big 10 school, but since the Manhattan Project, we are no longer :(  Our football games aren't really the biggest event on campus, but theres a fan base.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life has a presence, but isn't huge. Frats have parties all the time and people involved in greek life are not snooty and are mixed well into the community. Greek life is growing too!
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review:
Division III varsity athletics, meaning, as good as the athletes might be, events are less attended than pee-wee football.

Club athletics are present, and a big part of life for those participating.

IM and informal athletics are also present, fun, and a significant part of House life (or at least, competitors usually compete by house).
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The student body is very ethnically diverse. However, I have seen little evidence for socioeconomic diversity. this is often the (possibly inevitable) case at rigorous and selective private universities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The campus does not care about drugs or alcohol. My friend had a bong in his room that the RH saw and he didn't care. They just want you to be safe, and I love that!
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review:
Seriously relaxed. The University puts trust in the Resident Heads of each dorm house, and they in turn put a lot of trust in the students. They are cool uncles and aunts, not parents. 

Obviously the absolute no-nos are sexual assault and discrimination or anything along those lines. Any punishment determined by the administration for those type of actions are free game.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The sports themselves don't get a lot of popular attention, but the kids in them enjoy them, and Ratner is a wonderful, beautiful gym.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I've never had so many Indian friends in my life, including one girl who's actually from New Delhi.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I feel like there aren't as many cute boys as I would prefer, but there are definitely gems in this school, I know a lot of good guys in my house that would make any girl happy.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: University of Chicago is a place of great diversity. 18% of student body are international students from all over the world therefore there are students of almost every religion. UChicago offers huge support to development of students' unique personality. For instance there are many clubs where students can embrace and share their religion, political beliefs, culture etc. I appreciate this approach as I have chance to learn about all these essential parts of one's personality.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: they all seem very good looking and well groomed compared to other girls and guys
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Drinking is mostly tolerated as long as it's safe. If the administration or other people don't have to worry about it (i.e. you're being safe/not bothering people), then they're pretty fine with it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
Chicago varsity ports are D3. But the best of D3.Club sports also do well for themselves. However, few people attend any formal athletic events and there is little school spirit (at leas in the bleachers) to be spoken of.

Facilities are top-notch.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Our athletics are not our strong suit. During WWII the Manhattan project was below our football stadium, and our sports have not really recovered since then (although all of the radiation has been scrubbed).
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There's Some Hot Men.... If You Know Where to Look – Let me start: I've met a lot of nice, fun, and overall, interesting people at the school. They aren't necessarily attractive though. I think the girls get put down for their looks: there are lots of fit, fun, and sporty girls at Chicago. With guys though, they are either socially awkward, boys in football frats, or unattractive guys who think they have chances with good looking girls (my best friend is a great example). It takes a lot of effort to find someone attractive, smart, and interesting here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
Northwestern's rowing coaches have been heard saying, "Don't worry guys. All we have to do this time, is beat UChicago." 
Athletics at UChicago are not very good. If you're looking for competitive, active, well-attended varsity sports, don't come here. If you're looking for an academically focused school that HAS varsity sports, sure.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
Greeks Positive Force on Campus – Greeks really don't dominate the scene. If you look for them, they're there. If your social circle is mainly Greek, then Greeks seem to be everywhere. If you're not, then Greek life is as invisible as you want to make it. In fact, many people have no idea when rush week is - it's that quiet.
Greek life is a positive force on campus, hosting philanthropic events including the annual (and hilarious) male beauty pageant, among others. Greek life at UChicago is way different from Greek life at other schools, namely state schools. Here, the implicit priority focus of almost all Greek members is academics first. The Greek system is truly a positive force on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Do what you want as long as you don't hurt yourself – In a nutshell, the University knows that you are in college, and they'll let you do just about anything until you're harming yourself or others. As such, the alcohol and drug policy is one of the most relaxed I've heard of. Parties only get broken up due to volume, and I've never heard of any real consequences.  Your house likely won't care if you have alcohol as long as it stays in the rooms, and even that policy is often ignored. As for as drugs outside of alcohol, the policy gets more strict the harder the drug. The school does little to police marijuana; people will smoke relatively openly outside without any problems. I've heard of the occasional police incident, but nothing beyond throwing out the drugs and absolutely no real problems. Harder drugs are around and policed as necessary, but as long as you're keeping it to yourself and friends, there will still likely be no problems. The UChicago Police is a constant presence, but they're basically there to make sure you don't die; they don't care what you do as long as you're safe. Thus, drug policy is simply a "pay no heed unless we have to" ideal.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Awesome Facilities, but Few Really Care. There's tons of school spirit to be sure, but it's all on the academic side of things. Very few people seem to pay attention to varsity athletics at all (it is only a D3 school, after all). That being said, our teams seem to generally do pretty well. In addition, the main gym - Ratner - is an excellent facility open to all students. Combine that with a reasonably active intramural scene, and you'll be able to find athletic activity here should you want it. That being said, if athletics are a priority, UChicago will seem sorely lacking.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Depends on Who You Find – Like any institution of elite education, UChicago might be perceived as largely caucasian upper class. If you look outside the marked lines, you'll see that isn't true. Depending on who you find there, you will realize that UChicago is as diverse as the city it is centered in.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: As a true sampling of the average population, there are great looking, average looking, and bad looking people at the University of Chicago. That being said, everyone is super intelligent and for the most part very kind and caring. So don't judge a book by it's cover and take a chance!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: A for Effort – We did have a good program, until WWII came around and we built the largest sustained nuclear reactor under our football field.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek Life builds a great community. Each organization raises a lot of money for charity (from $5000-20,0000), and the parties are great! It's not really elitist.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Super Lenient School – Uchicago is a "wet" campus, and as long as you don't do anything ridiculously stupid (like fire a bb-gun in your dorm at other students, someone I know did this and was kicked out of housing) you'll be fine and not bothered.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Don't Ask, Don't Tell – The RHs and RAs vary from house to house, but the general feeling is you can do whatever you want in the confines of your room.  Many people drink openly in their rooms and leave marijuana or alcohol out in their dorms.  That being said, smoking inside is heavily discouraged (while not discouraged at all outside).  Hard drugs are frowned upon by the administration.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Very Lenient Except for Very Stupid Things. The school is very lenient about alcohol. As long as you behave safely, they won't do anything. You just can't have alcohol out in public. Possession of other drugs is punished, but it's not like they are going to search you. The campus police is fantastic - they are there to protect you, and won't give you any trouble unless you are being an idiot.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: UChicago gets a bad reputation for being full of dorky, gross-looking individuals. While you can certainly find plenty of these people, they're not the majority. There are definitely some attractive guys on the sports teams (which we apparently have??) or in Greek life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The Greek Life here is a) insignificant b) a very different breed to  'Animal House' and c) not even an accurate reflection of our night life. For the most part, the value system commonly associated with Greek life is very out of sync with the uchicago mindset as a whole. That being said, it's there if you want it. Sororites do not have housing at uchicago. Also, if you're really interested in this, go to the Maroon website (school newspaper) and look up the recent controversial involving fraternities and racial slurs.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Very Diverse – The University is very diverse with students from all over the world and only 10% from in state.  I have met people from Hong Kong, Africa, London, and dozens of other countries.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greeks Are Important but Small – Greek life at the University of Chicago is small but growing.  Traditionally, much of the student body had not joined in Greek Life, but fraternities have been growing, with new fraternities coming to campus every year.  Sororities are also getting larger, and are also adding more sisters.  UChicago fraternities are very UChicago, with many of the brothers truly seeking out a sense of brotherhood and community.  Also, as a brother of the Alpha Epsilon Pi Fraternity I would be remiss if I did not mention the important impact that Greek organizations have on FUN!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Men and Women Live Together – The housing policy at the University of Chicago is very lenient in terms of the co-ed living situation. Women and men live on the same floor, share communal bathrooms, and even are allowed to room together. It is one of the most interesting college housing policies that I know of because it gives the students to craft their own living arrangements. In many instances the students respect this freedom and I have yet to hear of its abuse. It makes the social lives of the students distinct because of the responsibility it entrusts them with.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Although I am not a varsity athlete, I have participated in several intramural or house-based teams, including basketball, soccer,and flag football.  The facilities are fine, and it's a great way to get some exercise, have some fun, and meet some other kids at your school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Getting Better – I think the university is trying to sever its image of a purely nerd school with kids who have poor hygiene.  The girls are noticeably more attractive, transitioning to a Zoey Deschanel-like class.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: IM SO FUNNNN – Intramurals. I don't pay attention to anything else.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Not Strict at All – As long as you don't go a total rampage, the campus cops wouldn't bother you.  I've actually taken shots with a cop while I was drunk.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are people of all walks of life on campus. We have a substantial international population and students from almost every state. The Office of Multicultural Student Affairs (OMSA) and 5710 provide resources and opportunities for discussion for all students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Students at UChicago are usually dedicated to one thing: getting to where they want to go. This is pretty attractive, and most students find themselves linking up with someone who has the same ambitions as they do.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Safe but Not Strict – Especially in the dorms, RAs are out to make sure you are having a safe and responsible time, but there isn't a strict process of getting "written up" for anything. They treat you like adults and expect you to behave appropriately; they'll come tell you to quiet down if you're partying after (generous) quiet hours, but they're not out to be the bad guy.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: There is definitely diversity. Yet, the population is mostly made up white and asian people. There are other races represented but it is not as much as the school and the students would like. However, the community for minority is vibrant and exciting to be part of for those who get involved. As for all the other kinds of diversity, like sexual orientation, socioeconomic class, political belies and religion, we have everything. It is great to be surrounded by people of such vastly different backgrounds!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: If you consider the various subdivisions of "White" and "Asian" as contributors to diversity, then I suppose one could argue that UChicago is in fact diverse. That having been said, diversity in a more practical and perhaps broader sense is somewhat lacking. Blacks and Hispanics, for example, are few in number relative to the two other aforementioned races. Culturally speaking, a lot of minorities at the U of C are a little on the whitewashed/hipster side and either bury their ethnicity or flaunt it feebly as if they have something to prove.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The police are their to keep the students safe and honestly they don't care about much else. Keeping us safe in Hyde Park is a hand full, so I can't really blame them. Most academic infractions are dealt with fairly, but are so sparse its hardly an issue.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Popular, but Not Over-Bearing – The Greek life is present on campus, often hosting parties on the weekends, but not that many people are involved in the actual frats. It is not at all a big deal if you are not in a frat, and there are many options besides going to frat parties
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Since the students here are mostly the nerdy, quiet types, I haven't heard of anyone doing something extreme and getting expelled.  The school is very intense about some things, though, so I would imagine you would get into big trouble if you did something wrong.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: It's been rising in recent years, but the Greek presence is still very, very quiet.  There is a noisy frat house across from the Seminary Co-op that can be entertaining, though.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: There but Not Overwhelming – There's definitely greek life on campus, but you don't feel left out socially if you don't go to greek events.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Incredibly Diverse Student Body – One of my favorite parts of UChicago has been meeting so many people and making friends who are so different from me. When I lived in the dorm my first year I met people from all different races, economic situations, geographic backgrounds, religions, and sexual orientations. I found that people were really open to learning from each other and interested in the different experiences people had had.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: It's a given that everyone here is smart (not pretentious, in-your-face smart, but more subtle, witty smart), but folks here are pretty good-looking too. Some people dress up for class, but on the whole, the atmosphere is more casual (people usually wear jeans and sneakers more than they do skirts and heels, unless they're on their way to an interview, of course). Dating here happens pretty frequently. First dates can pretty much happen anywhere, at the restaurants near campus like the Med, at the on campus movie theater, or even in the library! People will sometimes take a trip downtown to go get dinner and a movie, and then come back to campus for a party at a friends apartment or frat. In terms of interests, people here really run the gamut. A lot of people are into TV shows like the Wire, the Daily Show, or Breaking Bad, and almost everyone plays IM sports with their house.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Very Chill – UChicago is the kind of place where students police themselves.  In the dorms, the RAs are really chill and there isn't actually a formal way to get "written up," for alcohol or anything, although they still expect you to try and behave responsibly (most people do, even if drinking). The campus police are great with students. they may show up to a loud party in a fraternity or an apartment but they will rarely do anything beyond telling people to go home.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: The athletic scene is just barely starting to creep up.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Yeah...What Strictness? Not even police care that you're drinking. They'll shut down a party if someone complains, but other that, no one cares.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Tight-Knit and Growing – Greek life is not HUGE at UChicago - no one can deny it. No one can say that it's on the level of a state school. However, Greek Life at UChicago is definitely something to appreciate. It's relatively small, however, they're a huge part of campus nightlife and social life. Unlike many other schools, there isn't a sharp, obnoxious divide between Greeks and non-Greeks. Going Greek (or not going Greek) is a personal choice, and isn't something that defines someone's entire life here. Overall, Greek life is so fun. You meet a lot of people you wouldn't come across otherwise, and being part of a smaller community is nice. It's pretty tight-knit, so for those who are a part of it, it's like having a mini-community of awesome people within the wider university.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Diverse, Without a Doubt – When my friends ask me what UChicago's stereotype is, I can't really say. There are a lot of different types of people, and yes, there are a lot of large groups of certain types of people (like hipsters, people like to joke). However, all around - in terms of race, interests, geographic locations, personalities - UChicago has a great variety of students. There's not a single prevailing type of student that may  be found at other schools. Here, I really do believe that everyone can find a group of people they fit in well with - academically, socially, extracurricularly.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Brains and Beauty? Yeah so the girls don't go to UChicago for their looks, but I was pleasantly surprised to find a substantial pocket of attractive girls, but it can be hard at first to find the lookers. On the plus-side though, if you do find them, chances are very high that they're smarter than you and will be genuinely interesting girls.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Friends from Around the World – The diversity at Uchicago gave me a friend group that no other single place could provide. I grew up in the greatest melting pot in the world, NYC, and still I was amazed by the vast diversity on campus. I have made friends from literally all around the world and now that I have just graduated college I am spending my summer visiting some of them in their home towns, including Athens, Tel Aviv and New Delhi, just to name a few!
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: You Are Responsible for Yourself – They will punish you of course if you are doing something horrendously dangerous or illegal, but the general policy on things like drinking is lax. Any form of cheating though is taken very seriously, and even small mistakes can cost you your degree.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Not a Thing – Fraternities are not home to most students or good parties. Avoid most of them. Greek life only involves about 10% of the student body
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Looking at "diversity" in the traditional sense, the numbers do not lie--UChicago is a fairly diverse campus.  The true beauty of that, though, is the diversity of ideas that come up in classroom discussion.  Everyone has different backgrounds/perspectives/ideas to contribute, and this leads to the full development of UChicago's trademark "Life of the Mind"
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Guys and Girls – Fashion isn't that big at this school.  You'll find a lot of hipsters, even more smokers, and a lot of the normal type.  Looks are pretty average and not a lot of people take a whole lot of care of themselves.  No one is downright ugly, but every way you look you won't be overwhelmed by overmaintained beauty either.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There, but Not Mandatory – U of C athletes often get knocked for being affiliated with a largely academic school. I think the link is unfounded. Many of my friends who are athletes spend a terrific amount of time within their sport and have created strong networks within it. Many of our teams are nationally ranked and overall very competitive across their divisions.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: While the Greek community is only 10% of the student body, they certainly do a lot. It is also very inclusive and collaborative, both with each other (between Greek organizations) and with the external non-Greek community. It isn't nearly as competitive and "Animal House-like" as some schools might be. Some non-Greeks like the Greek community and hang out with them a lot, while some non-Greeks dislike the Greek community. It really just depends on who you ask. However, I'd say overall, the Greek community has a positive reputation.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Not a State School, but Fun – I didn't join a sorority, but I enjoyed hanging out at the fraternities, especially in my first and second year. The parties they throw are definitely not state school-status, but you can still drink, dance, and make your own fun. In general, I think Greek life adds something to our school and social life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Fan support is abysmal, but several of the teams are very competative in Division III.  The Women's Soccer Team, the Cross Country/Track Team, and especially the Tennis team come to mind. Ratner, the main athletics facility is modern and awesome.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: One of the first things that struck me about the University of Chicago was the diversity of students on campus. There's a good number of every major ethnicity, although Asian, White, and Indian are probably most common (there's a good crowd of brazilian students as well).  Political and religious beliefs are just as widespread, and although the campus is largely liberal, the College Republicans have one of the biggest student organizations on campus. There's daily worship at the beautiful Rockefeller Chapel for numerous religions. The LGBTQ community is extremely active as well.  There are numerous activist and gay rights organizations on campus and the LGBTQ community is widely accepted and respected by straight students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: You're Smart Enough to Make Your Own Choices – From the moment you hit the University of Chicago for Orientation, the message is clear.  You are smart enough to make your own choices, and smart enough to make the right ones.  Drinking policies, while in place, are lax and rarely enforced by housing or the police.  Drugs are come down upon more strongly (obviously).  As long as you aren't getting wasted in public or are a raging alcoholic who is failing out, you're pretty much golden.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review:
Too Nerdy to Care – The University of Chicago isn't filled with ugly people (though there are some unfortunates out there).  Some of the guys and girls here are very attractive.  Most of the time, it isn't easy to tell.  So many people here are too busy trying to keep up academically, there is minimal to no time spent grooming.  You'll notice that a large share of people wear unflattering sweatshirts and sweatpants.

On the other hand, if you're into nerds or hipsters, this is definitely place for you!
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Lots of Whites and Asians – People from the University of Chicago come from a variety of countries, cultures, races/ethnic origins, ideologies and socio-economic backgrounds.  Although, a majority of the school is comprised primarily of white and Asian students (a large part of the international students are from Asian as well).  So diversity is there, just not quite A+ level.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: You'd Be Surprised – Girls are all over the place at Chicago, most are at least pretty but a lot have very specific styles and that I guess could be off-putting. Plenty of guys are friendly and nice but there is also a fair number of guys who are more on the stuck up side. These guys tend to believe that they're always the smartest guys in the room. On the other side of the coin, there are the guys who are more socially awkward and they can be tough to deal with too - especially because they have trouble taking a hint. You're better off just being honest. Oh, and by the way despite reports to the contrary, there are some seriously attractive guys at Chicago.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Sports Exist – We are a division three school so low turnout at sports events comes with the territory.   We do our best to tailgate and have a good time but its always going to be pretty lackluster.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is a small but important part of the University of Chicago. Though the University does not always show its support of Greek life, it still has a strong influence on the social atmosphere of the campus. Once a year, the sororities host their philanthropy events, which draw Greeks and non-Greeks alike. The events are always fun to attend! Past events have included a male beauty pageant, family feud, and a basketball tournament. The fraternities host parties, usually every weekend. Greek life does not dominate the campus, so you can choose to participate in events hosted by Greek life, or you can find plenty of other alternatives.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The University of Chicago has a very diverse campus. Many international students attend the college as well as students with varying economic, political, and religious beliefs. As such, the campus community is very tolerant and accepting.  Diversity is one the factors that drew me to the University of Chicago initially, and I am glad to be part of such a diverse and vibrant student body.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The majority of students are not involved in Greek life, however it is very present if you're interested. Most parties for first and some second years are thrown by the fraternities, where you can typically see the same crowd repeatedly. If you have many friend in the Greek system or attend parties regularly, then Greek life tends to feel like it is everywhere. If not then there is no pressure to attend events or even to join a fraternity or sorority.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The UCPD are so lax and easygoing about everything; their job is not to arrest you for underage drinking, but to make sure that you are safe when you're intoxicated. Occasionally they'll shut down a party or two but other than that our campus is not strict at all.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Despite the fact that the majority of the faculty and student body has not been to an athletics game, they do exist, and are pretty successful. We are a part of the UAA conference along with schools like Washington University in St. Louis, NYU and Emory. It's a great thing to be a part of and more people should really start going to the games.
